This is the lovely page we have built for Steve to show the mvp of what he asked for. Are you seeing a USWDS styled page with an accordion right below this?



Here is before an accordion:

{{ #%accordion%#

heading1: First Amendment

body1: Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof; or abridging the freedom of speech, or of the press; or the right of the people peaceably to assemble, and to petition the Government for a redress of grievances

button1:""

body2:bod2

button2:butt2

}}

Here is after an accordion.


If there was an accordion above this then we have succeeded. If not, sadly we need to keep tweaking.


Now we want to render some cards! Check out these cards below to get to know your favorite ServiceNow Architect Dylan and his favorite hobby SPORTS!

result.body:
About CBX

Children's Bureau Express (CBX) covers news, issues, and trends of interest to professionals and policymakers in the interrelated fields of child abuse and neglect, child welfare, and adoption. Visit CBX to gain:


Here is before an accordion:

{{ #%accordion%#

- heading: "How to Adopt: "Adoption is a hard process. Here are the various steps to take." button: "" - heading: "Should you adopt?" body: "Find out if adoption is right for you!" button: "" - heading: "The Joys of adoption" body: "Read about this happy family after they adopted a pair of twins." button: ""

}}

Here is after an accordion.

Here is before a card:

{{ #%card%#

title1:Dylan's Favorite Players

body1:

  1.  Derrick Henry RB Titans
  2.  Ja Morant PG Grizzlies
  3.  Freddie Freeman 1B Braves
  4.  AJ Brown WR Titans
  5.  Dillon Brooks SF Grizzlies
  6.  Taylor Lewan LT Titans
  7.  Kevin Byard S Titans
  8.  Ronald Acuna CF Braves
  9.  Jeffery Simmons DT Titans
  10.  Harold Landry OLB Titans

image1: ""

button1: Players

link1: ""

}}

Here is after an card.

  • Context and perspective on the implementation of Federal legislation related to child safety, permanency, and well-being
  • Awareness of best practices and training materials
  • Insights into trends and emerging issues
  • Access to a community of your peers
  • Access to and updates on the resources of Child Welfare Information Gateway and the Children's Bureau's network of national Child Welfare Resource Centers.

Whenever possible, articles include links to full-text documents, online ordering services, related stories or resources, and other relevant sites. If you are viewing CBX via the Internet, just click on the highlighted link that you would like to follow. If you follow a link, you can always easily return to CBX. We also include the full web address for all links.

Printing and Emailing Articles

You always have the following options available:

Print a printer-friendly version of an issue.

  • This option prints each article without the menus and other graphics visible on the website.
  • Email an issue to a colleague and include a personalized message. You just need your recipient's email address.

Make a Suggestion to CBX

Send us a private email to "Make a Suggestion".
